test-set.name: prod-GroupByClause
test-set.description: Tests for the GroupByClause production in XQuery 3.0

test-case.name: group-001
test-case.description: Group atomic values
test-case.test: for $x in 1 to 100 let $key := $x mod 10 group by $key return string(text{$x})

test-case.name: group-001a
test-case.description: Group atomic values using new syntax agreed Sept 2011

test-case.name: group-002
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, using nodes as input

modified.change: correct test and allow permutation of results

test-case.test: for $x in //employee let $key := $x/@gender group by $key return concat($key, ':', string-join(for $e in $x return $e/@name/string(), ','))

result.assert-permutation: "female:Jane Doe 1,Jane Doe 3,Jane Doe 5,Jane Doe 7,Jane Doe 9,Jane Doe 11,Jane Doe 13", "male:John Doe 2,John Doe 4,John Doe 6,John Doe 8,John Doe 10,John Doe 12"

test-case.name: group-002a
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, using nodes as input, using new Sept 2011 syntax
test-case.test: for $x in //employee group by $key := $x/@gender return concat($key, ':', string-join(for $e in $x return $e/@name/string(), ','))

result.assert-permutation: "female:Jane Doe 1,Jane Doe 3,Jane Doe 5,Jane Doe 7,Jane Doe 9,Jane Doe 11,Jane Doe 13", "male:John Doe 2,John Doe 4,John Doe 6,John Doe 8,John Doe 10,John Doe 12"

test-case.name: group-003
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, using nodes as input, boolean grouping key

modified.change: correct test and allow permutation of results

result.assert-permutation: "false:Jane Doe 1,Jane Doe 3,Jane Doe 5,Jane Doe 7,Jane Doe 9,Jane Doe 11,Jane Doe 13", "true:John Doe 2,John Doe 4,John Doe 6,John Doe 8,John Doe 10,John Doe 12"

test-case.name: group-003a
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, using nodes as input, boolean grouping key; using new Sept 2011 syntax
test-case.test: for $x in //employee group by $key := ($x/@gender = 'male') return concat($key, ':', string-join(for $e in $x return $e/@name/string(), ','))

result.assert-permutation: "false:Jane Doe 1,Jane Doe 3,Jane Doe 5,Jane Doe 7,Jane Doe 9,Jane Doe 11,Jane Doe 13", "true:John Doe 2,John Doe 4,John Doe 6,John Doe 8,John Doe 10,John Doe 12"

test-case.name: group-004
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, using nodes as input, aggregate over a group

modified.change: correct test and allow permutation of results

test-case.test: for $x in //employee let $key := $x/@gender group by $key return concat($key, ':', avg($x/hours))

test-case.name: group-005
test-case.description: Basic grouping test, multivalued grouping key, currently an error
test-case.test: for $x in //employee let $key := $x/hours group by $key return <group hours="{$key}" avHours="{avg($x/hours)}"/>

test-case.name: group-006
test-case.description: A grouping key can be empty
test-case.test:
<out>{ 
            for $x in //employee 
            group by $key := $x/status 
            return <group status="{$key}" count="{count($x)}"/> 
        }</out>

test-case.name: group-007
test-case.description: Group by with a where clause
test-case.test: for $x in //employee let $key := $x/hours[1] group by $key where count($x) gt 2 return concat($key, ':', count($x))

test-case.name: group-008
test-case.description: Group by with an order-by clause

modified.change: make results predictable by adding second order key

test-case.test: <out>{ for $x in //employee let $key := $x/empnum group by $key order by count($x), $key return <group count="{count($x)}"> {string-join($x/@name, '|')} </group> }</out>

result.assert-xml: <out><group count="2">Jane Doe 7|John Doe 8</group><group count="2">Jane Doe 9|John Doe 10</group><group count="3">Jane Doe 11|John Doe 12|Jane Doe 13</group><group count="6">Jane Doe 1|John Doe 2|Jane Doe 3|John Doe 4|Jane Doe 5|John Doe 6</group></out>

test-case.name: group-009
test-case.description: Group by with a collation, and with sorting
test-case.test: <out>{ for $x in //employee let $key := $x/empnum group by $key collation "http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/collation/codepoint" order by $key return <group count="{count($x)}" key="{$key}"> {string-join($x/pnum, '|')} </group> }</out>

result.assert-xml: <out><group count="6" key="E1">P1|P2|P3|P4|P5|P6</group><group count="2" key="E2">P1|P2</group><group count="2" key="E3">P2|P2</group><group count="3" key="E4">P2|P4|P5</group></out>

test-case.name: group-009a
test-case.description: Group by with a collation, and with sorting; using new (Sept 2011) syntax
test-case.test:
<out>{ 
            for $x in //employee 
            group by $key := $x/empnum collation "http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/collation/codepoint" 
            order by $key 
            return <group count="{count($x)}" key="{$key}"> {string-join($x/pnum, '|')} </group> 
        }</out>

result.assert-xml: <out><group count="6" key="E1">P1|P2|P3|P4|P5|P6</group><group count="2" key="E2">P1|P2</group><group count="2" key="E3">P2|P2</group><group count="3" key="E4">P2|P4|P5</group></out>

test-case.name: group-010
test-case.description: NaN values go in the same group
test-case.test:
<out>{ 
            for $x in //employee 
            let $key := if ($x/@gender='male') then number('NaN') else 42 
            group by $key 
            return <group key="{$key}" count="{count($x)}"/> 
        }</out>

test-case.name: group-011
test-case.description: Group by with position variable (Bug report on Saxon submitted by Leo WÃ¶rteler of BaseX)
test-case.test: for $a at $p in 1 to 10 let $g := $p mod 2 group by $g return string-join($p!string(), ' ')

test-case.name: group-012
test-case.description: Grouping of an empty sequence
test-case.test:
<out>{ 
            for $x in //employee[age > 300] 
            let $key := @gender 
            group by $key 
            return <group gender="{$key}"> { 
                        for $e in $x return <person>{$e/@name/string()}</person> 
                   } </group> 
        }</out>

test-case.name: group-013
test-case.description: Grouping by already existing variable
test-case.test: for $x in 1 to 10, $y in 1 to 4 let $org_y := $y group by $y, $y := $x mod 2 return <grp y="{$org_y[1]}" even="{$y}">{$x}</grp>

test-case.name: group-014
test-case.description: Referenced grouping variable is not in the tuple stream.
test-case.test: let $x := 1 return for $i in ("a", "b") group by $x return ($x, count($i))

test-case.name: group-015
test-case.description: No value comparisons are available to compare the grouping keys.

test-case.name: group-016
test-case.description: In the first grouping spec, the grouping variable does not reference the generated let binding. See also group-013
test-case.test: count( for $y in 1 to 10 group by $y := $y, $y := $y mod 2 return $y )

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q1
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q1
test-case.test:
<sales-qty-by-product>{
                 for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record
                 let $pname := $sales/product-name
                 group by $pname
                 order by $pname
                 return
                   <product name="{$pname}">{
                     sum($sales/qty)
                   }</product>
               }</sales-qty-by-product>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q2
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q2
test-case.test: <result>{ for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record let $state := $stores-doc/*/store[store-number = $sales/store-number]/state let $category := $products-doc/*/product[name = $sales/product-name]/category group by $state, $category order by $state, $category return <group> <state>{$state}</state> <category>{$category}</category> <total-qty>{sum($sales/qty)}</total-qty> </group> }</result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q3
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q3
test-case.test: <result>{ for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record let $state := $stores-doc/*/store[store-number = $sales/store-number]/state, $product := $products-doc/*/product[name = $sales/product-name], $category := $product/category, $revenue := $sales/qty * $product/price group by $state, $category order by $state, $category return <group> <state>{$state}</state> <category>{$category}</category> <total-revenue>{sum($revenue)}</total-revenue> </group> }</result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q4
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q4
test-case.test: <result>{ for $store in $stores-doc/*/store let $state := $store/state group by $state order by $state return <state name="{$state}">{ for $product in $products-doc/*/product let $category := $product/category group by $category order by $category return <category name="{$category}">{ for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record[store-number = $store/store-number and product-name = $product/name] let $pname := $sales/product-name group by $pname order by $pname return <product name="{$pname}" total-qty="{sum($sales/qty)}" /> }</category> }</state> }</result>

result.assert-xml: <result><state name="CA"><category name="clothes"><product name="socks" total-qty="510"/></category><category name="kitchen"><product name="broiler" total-qty="20"/><product name="toaster" total-qty="150"/></category></state><state name="MA"><category name="clothes"><product name="shirt" total-qty="10"/></category><category name="kitchen"><product name="blender" total-qty="250"/><product name="toaster" total-qty="50"/></category></state><state name="WA"><category name="clothes"/><category name="kitchen"/></state></result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q5
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q5
test-case.test:
<result>{
                 for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record
                 let $storeno := $sales/store-number
                 group by $storeno
                 order by $storeno
                 return
                   <store number = "{$storeno}">{
                     for $s in $sales
                     order by xs:int($s/qty) descending
                     return
                       <product name = "{$s/product-name}" qty = "{$s/qty}"/>
                   }</store>
               }</result>

result.assert-xml: <result><store number="1"><product name="socks" qty="500"/><product name="broiler" qty="20"/></store><store number="2"><product name="toaster" qty="100"/><product name="toaster" qty="50"/><product name="socks" qty="10"/></store><store number="3"><product name="blender" qty="150"/><product name="blender" qty="100"/><product name="toaster" qty="50"/><product name="shirt" qty="10"/></store></result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q6
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q6
test-case.test:
<result>{
                 for $sales in $sales-records-doc/*/record
                 let $storeno := $sales/store-number,
                   $product := $products-doc/*/product[name = $sales/product-name],
                   $prd := $product,
                   $profit := $sales/qty * ($prd/price - $prd/cost)
                 group by $storeno
                 let $total-store-profit := sum($profit)
                 where $total-store-profit > 100
                 order by $total-store-profit descending
                 return
                   <store number = "{$storeno}" total-profit = "{$total-store-profit}"/>
                }</result>

result.assert-xml: <result><store number="3" total-profit="7320"/><store number="2" total-profit="3030"/><store number="1" total-profit="2100"/></result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q7
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q7
test-case.test:
<result>{
                 for $book in $books-doc/*/book
                 for $author in $book/author
                 group by $author
                 order by $author
                 return
                 <author name="{$author}">{
                   for $b in $book
                   order by $b/title
                   return
                     <title> {fn:data($b/title)} </title>
                 }</author>
               }</result>

result.assert-xml: <result><author name="Alan Simon"><title>SQL:1999</title><title>Strategic Database Technology</title></author><author name="Andrew Eisenberg"><title>Understanding SQL and Java Together</title></author><author name="Jim Melton"><title>Advanced SQL:1999</title><title>Querying XML</title><title>SQL:1999</title><title>Understanding SQL and Java Together</title></author><author name="Stephen Buxton"><title>Querying XML</title></author></result>

test-case.name: use-case-groupby-Q8
test-case.description: Use Case "Group By" - Q8
test-case.test:
<result>{
                 for $book in $books-doc/*/book
                 let $author-list := fn:string-join($book/author, ', ')
                 group by $author-list
                 order by $author-list
                 return
                   <author-list names="{$author-list}">{
                     for $b in $book
                     order by $b/title
                     return
                       <title> {fn:data($b/title)} </title>
                   }</author-list>
               }</result>

result.assert-xml: <result><author-list names="Alan Simon"><title>Strategic Database Technology</title></author-list><author-list names="Jim Melton"><title>Advanced SQL:1999</title></author-list><author-list names="Jim Melton, Alan Simon"><title>SQL:1999</title></author-list><author-list names="Jim Melton, Andrew Eisenberg"><title>Understanding SQL and Java Together</title></author-list><author-list names="Jim Melton, Stephen Buxton"><title>Querying XML</title></author-list></result>
